definition: to grab/to snatch up/variant of 焯[chao1]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: This skill earned him the nicknames "Air Jordan" and "His Airness.
sentences.chinese: 这个技术为他博得了飞人乔丹和空中传奇的绰号。

sentences.english: We always nickname him “Little Lazy Cat”.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是叫他的绰号“小懒猫”。

sentences.english: 'The human sound-track' he nicknamed her in his own mind.
sentences.chinese: 在心里他给她个绰号，就叫“人体录音带”。

sentences.english: They nicknamed him" Fats" because of his weight.
sentences.chinese: 因为他胖，人们给他取个绰号叫“胖子”。

sentences.english: Or they also got the nickname for several other reasons.
sentences.chinese: 他们得到这个绰号还有其他原因。

sentences.english: No one north of Berwick is likely to disagree.
sentences.chinese: 贝里克郡以北没有人会不认同这一绰号。

sentences.english: Rafael Nadal is nicknamed " Rada " by his friends and family.
sentences.chinese: 在朋友和家人中，他的绰号是“纳豆”。

sentences.english: Self-given nick names are straight-up garbage and should never be used.
sentences.chinese: 自封绰号是彻头彻尾的垃圾，谁都不该用。

sentences.english: Barry Popik's website lists almost one hundred nicknames that describe New York.
sentences.chinese: 巴里Popik的网站列出了近百个绰号，形容纽约。

sentences.english: Who was known as the Little Corporal?
Does the king, strip weathers have one more victory before retirement.
sentences.chinese: 绰号国王这辆车，能在退休前，再取得一次胜利么？

sentences.english: The team acquired the sobriquet Jail Blazers.
sentences.chinese: 球队得到一个新绰号“监狱者”。

sentences.english: The Hong Kong report was posted by a person with the nickname "Shui Jinghuang".
sentences.chinese: 香港的报告是一个绰号叫“水晶皇”的人发布的。

sentences.english: Korean media even gave her the a "King Kong Barbie" nickname.
sentences.chinese: 韩媒甚至给她起了一个“金刚芭比”的绰号。

sentences.english: This has earned it the renown and sobriquet "The moonstone on the Crown of the Kingdom of Plants".
sentences.chinese: 这赢得了名声和绰号“月光石，对官方的植物王国”。

sentences.english: China News has gone so far as to christen a nickname
sentences.chinese: 中国媒体走得更远，已经开始起绰号了。

definition: refined appelation/(humor) sb's elegant monicker/(hon.) your esteemed name
person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
name (of a person or thing)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to be called/to be known as
stage name (of an actor or actress)
